Sergio Marchionne said he wanted to introduce profit-sharing plans for Fiat's Italian workers, while stressing we have to make profits( at the plants), before we can share them. The car manufacturer met fierce opposition from the Italian General Confederation of Labor and its engineering workers' arm over the Turin agreement, which union officials said they considered an attack on labor rights. servant of this country". David Cameron said he was saddened by his departure, adding he felt his communications director was "being punished twice for the same offence." The PM said: This is all about the past. It has gone on and on and I can understand why he feels the pressure of that. "I choose to judge him by the work he has done for me for the government and for the country. He has run the Downing Street press office in a very straightforward, professional and competent way. David Cameron said he compared Andy Coulson 's regime favourably to "the days of dodgy dossiers, Alastair Campbell , Damian McBride , and all that nonsense we had from the past government".
